results.title: On guard for thee. Part 1. The Most dangerous spy
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Donald Brittain, Roger Hart and James Littleton
results.brief_description: The first in a trilogy of one-hour films on Canada’s national security operations and civil liberties during the past half-century. In 1946, Igor Gouzenko, a Soviet cipher clerk in Ottawa, fled his embassy with documents unveiling his nation’s spy network in Canada. It was Canada’s first spy case and confusion reigned in official reaction. Counter-intelligence agencies in the United States and Britain became alarmed at the possible leak of the new atom bomb secrets, so man-hunts soon reached international proportions. In Canada, the government ordered the arrest of many suspected citizens, civil rights were suspended, and the ensuing events became a blot on the nation’s history.

results.title: On guard
results.creator_credit: Red Heart Pictures, Digby Duncan and Susan Lambert
results.brief_description: A fast moving adventure about four women who conspire to sabotage the research program of Utero, a multinational firm engaged in reproductive engineering. They plan a midnight raid on Utero’s heavily guarded plant and as the time for the raid approaches, tensions between the four saboteurs increase.

results.title: On camera : The BBC video production course [kit]
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Harris Watts and Mike Crisp
results.brief_description: This practical training course for film and video production consists of four videos, each with an accompanying booklet, and a teacher’s guide. 1. ‘The camera’ compares the camera’s view of the world with the human eye, considers focal length and angle of view, outlines the terminology for shot sizes and camera moves, shows how to maintain continuity of direction (34min). 2. ‘Planning a program’ introduces the basic techniques of recording an event on camera, suggesting ways of improving coverage by planning ahead (17min). 3. ‘Interviews’ looks at how to tackle interviews both inside and outside the studio and how to maintain the viewer’s interest (21min). 4. ‘Editing’ introduces principles to guide your selection, order and length of shots and shows how your decisions will affect the way the story is told (20min).

results.title: On call to a nation
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Richard Cawston
results.brief_description: A review, consisting of many interviews with doctors of the British National Health Service ten years after it was started. Country and city general practitioners, specialists, public health doctors and hospital personnel discuss the failures and successes of the scheme, the emergence of partnerhsips, group practices and health centres, the shortage of dentists, and the growing gap between specialists and general practitioners, hospital deficiencies and the difficulties of the coutry practitioner with a small scattered population.

results.title: On borrowed time: the potter farm plan in action
results.brief_description: An eight part series which acts as a practical guide to farming with nature rather than against it and of realising the sustainability of the land, winning the war against soil degradation and maintaining productivity. Examines planning farm layout, water access and management, pasture and crop production, planting natural vegetation, fencing and siting of farms. Narrated by Neil Inall.

results.title: On a moonlit night
results.creator_credit: Italian International Film, Istituto Luce, Carthago Films, Raidue, Fulvio Lucisano and Lina Wertmüller
results.brief_description: John Knot is a man of the world and a lover of freedom and adventure. After years of reporting on wars, he devotes himself to reporting on the “plague of the century”, AIDS. Years ago while working together in Lebanon, John and Massimo, a young Italian photographer, met a woman photographer, Joelle. She and John had an affair and then suddenly one day she disappeared. Whilst travelling the world with Masimo, pretending to be HIV positive in order to record reactions from different people, he meets Joelle again in a Paris newspaper office. They make a vow never to separate again, but fate has other plans for them. Starring Rutger Hauer, Natassja Kinski, Faye Dunaway, Peter O’Toole and Lorraine Bracco. Costumes designed by Gianni Versace.

results.title: Ombudsman
results.brief_description: For 160 years Sweden has had Ombudsmen to whom the public can appeal directly in breaches of civil liberties, abuse of authority or any other apparent injustice. Explains the function of the Ombudsmen, through the reconstruction of typical cases where their independent investigations have resulted in the correction of injustices.

results.title: Oman today: the challenge
results.brief_description: Since the early seventies Oman has been involved in a development process that began with the opening of the country to the modern world. The role of UNICEF and other agencies, as well as specialists from other Arab countries is outlined.
